summary: Like anyone who owns a computer or smartphone, the Department of Defense has to continually update the software that keeps its weapon systems running smoothly. Sustaining that software for systems including aircraft, ships, submarines, and missiles, is essential for national defense. The cost of sustaining DOD's weapon system software is estimated to be at least $15 billion over the next 5 years, but DOD may...
title: Weapon System Sustainment: DOD Needs to Better Capture and Report Software Sustainment Costs
